ontA.label: Cohort (Metadata)
ontA.comment: An ontological representation of the Cohort parameters. The ontology has been automatically generated based on the uploaded Excel Document with Cohort Metadata (extracted on Date: 2018-10-02). This document has been also automatically generated based on the data recorded about 122 patients. For each patient, there are 63 Fields (Parameters aka Properties), the value of which often come from one out of 5 different controlled Set of Terms. Date of Cohort Inclusion Not available GN: Date of cohort inclusion is actually available in the original excel file, as DATE_DNA_SAMPLING. TC: The aforementioned Field/Column has been removed from the Excel File with the patient data (i.e., the one prepared for Data Harmonization purposes in 02/10/2018). Date of cohort inclusion is different than the Date of diagnosis Inclusion can be after diagnosis in old cases. The cohort was initiated in 2006. The Date of tests / conditions mentioned Not available The Date of tests / conditions mentioned ? The date/year the blood tests took place (including autoantibodies, hematological tests, etc.) also with the date/year of diagnosis of several medical conditions mentioned (e.g., Arthritis) is the same with the date/year of cohort inclusion ? GN: No, date can be before cohort inclusion. OK, it is clear that the date of tests / conditions mentioned is different than the date/year of cohort inclusion, but when they took place ? The Date of tests / conditions mentioned ? The date/year the Lab tests took place (i.e., autoantibody tests, Fields: Q to Y and Other Blood Test, Fields: AF to AR) and the date/year of diagnosis of several Medical Conditions or Symptoms (i.e., Fields: AS to BD) is the same with the date/year of diagnosis (i.e., Field H) ? If not, when these tests took place and when these conditions diagnosed ? GN: We have not recorded the dates for the lab tests or medical conditions. They are cumulative, i.e. are recorded as YES if they have ever appeared during the disease course. OK, so the exact date is practically not available The Date of tests / conditions mentioned ? Date of tests and when certain clinical features have appeared, has not been recorded. They are recorded if they ever appeard, i.e. cumulative manifestations. In theory, the dates can be retrieved from the medical charts, but this is a major undertaking and not feasable in practise. Old charts from deceased patients are no longer available at all. Number of Fields Ignored 23 Number of Fields we should Map 40 Metadata extracted have been revised by technical experts (in close collaboration with clinical experts).
ontA.creator: Institute of Communications and Computer Systems of National Technical University of Athens - ICCS/NTUA

ontB.label: HarmonicSS - Reference Model and Vocabularies
ontB.comment:
This ontology specifies the parameters of particular interest for the diagnosis, control and/or treatment of patients associated with the primary Sjogren Syndrome (pSS). 

The design of the ontology was driven by the documents with the minimum and maximum pSS parameters (D.4.1 revised) prepared by the Clinical Partners participating in the HarmonicSS project.

jsonarray.simcomments: The concepts have the same name. Strings "Male" and "Male" consist of the same sequence of characters.
The concepts have the same name. Strings "Female" and "Female" consist of the same sequence of characters.
There is another term with the same name (synonym). Strings "YES" and "YES" consist of the same sequence of characters.
The concepts have the same name. Strings "bone marrow" and "Bone Marrow" consist of the same sequence of characters.
The concepts have the same name. Strings "Bone marrow" and "Bone Marrow" consist of the same sequence of characters.
The concepts have the same name. Strings "lymph nodes" and "Lymph Nodes" consist of the same sequence of characters.
The concepts have the same name. Strings "spleen" and "Spleen" consist of the same sequence of characters.
The concepts have the same name. Strings "fatigue" and "Fatigue" consist of the same sequence of characters.
The concepts have the same name. Strings "fever" and "Fever" consist of the same sequence of characters.
The concepts have the same name. Strings "Raynaud" and "Raynaud's Phenomenon" consist of the same main elements.
The concepts have the same name. Strings "arthritis" and "Arthritis" consist of the same sequence of characters.

Diffuse Large B Cell lymphoma, not otherwise specified

Provides the appropriate Terms for the specific biopsy Test (including type - Salivary Gland) along with its Outcome and the Date it took place, based on the Value of the given Fields, the parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model terms and date format) and the Mapping Rules already specified. In case the 1st Field is empty or not aligned with the Confirmation terms, no data will be recorded. Also, in case the 2nd Field is empty, no information about the Test Date will be recorded.

arguments.argname: UNL and DNL Unit of Measurement

directTransformation.description: Provides the appropriate Term for the specific Lab Test and the Outcome Assessment based on the Value of the given Field, the parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model Lab Test and Assessment terms) and Mapping Rules specified. Also, provided that the UNL and DNL specified (including Unit of Measurement), the Normal Range of Values will be also recorded.

Provides the corresponding Reference Model term (i.e., Medical Condition) or not, taking into account the value of the given Field and the Mapping Rules specified (i.e., align Field Values with Confirmation Terms).

Provides the corresponding Reference Model term (i.e., Medical Condition) or not, taking into account the value of the given Field and the Mapping Rules specified (i.e., align Field Values with Confirmation Terms).

Provides the corresponding Reference Model term (i.e., Medical Condition) or not, taking into account the value of the given Field and the Mapping Rules specified (i.e., align Field Values with Confirmation Terms).

Provides the corresponding Reference Model term (i.e., Medical Condition) or not, taking into account the value of the given Field and the Mapping Rules specified (i.e., align Field Values with Confirmation Terms).

Provides the appropriate Term for the specific Lab Test and the Outcome Range, based on the Value of the given Field, the parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model Lab Test and Range of Values) and Mapping Rules specified. Also, provided that the UNL and DNL specified (including Unit of Measurement), the Normal Range of Values will be also recorded. In case the value of the field is empty or not aligned with the Confirmation terms or the Range of outcome Values not specified, no data will be recorded.

Provides the appropriate Terms for the specific Lab Test along with its Outcome, based on the Value of the given Field, the parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model term) and the Mapping Rules already specified.

Provides the appropriate Terms for the specific Lab Test along with its Outcome, based on the Value of the given Field, the parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model term) and the Mapping Rules already specified.

Provides the appropriate Term for the specific Lab Test and the Outcome measured based on the Value of the given Field and the additional parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model term and unit of measurement - both current and desirable). Also, provided that the UNL and DNL specified, the Normal Range of Values will be also recorded, as well as whether the outcome was normal or not. In case no Unit of Measurement specified in the Reference Model about the specific Lab Test, no data will be recorded.

Provides the appropriate Term for the specific Lab Test and the Outcome measured based on the Value of the given Field and the additional parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model term and unit of measurement - both current and desirable). Also, provided that the UNL and DNL specified, the Normal Range of Values will be also recorded, as well as whether the outcome was normal or not. In case no Unit of Measurement specified in the Reference Model about the specific Lab Test, no data will be recorded.

Provides a List of Entities with the corresponding Reference Model term (i.e., Symptom/Sign) along with the date the symptom/sign observed based on the value of the given Fields, additional data given (i.e., date format) and the Mapping Rules specified (i.e., mapping of cohort Symptom Terms/Values with the corresponding Reference Model terms about Symptoms). If the value of this Field is empty or none of the comma separated terms are aligned with the Reference Model Symptom/Sign terms, no data will be recorded.

Provides the appropriate Term for the specific Lab Test and the Outcome Range, based on the Value of the given Field, the parameters provided (i.e., corresponding Reference Model Lab Test and Range of Values) and Mapping Rules specified. Also, provided that the UNL and DNL specified (including Unit of Measurement), the Normal Range of Values will be also recorded. In case the value of the field is empty or not aligned with the Confirmation terms or the Range of outcome Values not specified, no data will be recorded.
